A map of current machine learning frameworks

Marie-Hélène Burle

Packages written for Python, but not in Python
For speed, using Fortran, C, or C++

Classic packages are available thanks to wrappers,
but many packages are written in Julia

Classic packages are available thanks to wrappers,
many packages written for R, but in C for speed

The Machine Learning CRAN Task View is a good resource

Language strengths:

Julia: fastest language by far, several very strong packages not available in other languages, all common packages ported through wrappers. Great for ML and DL Python: used by most people, most common packages developed for it. Great for DL, more limited options in ML R: largest library by far for stats and modelling, meaning incredible amount of options for ML. Slowest language, limited options for DL. Great for ML, limited for DL

party: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/party/index.html

gmodels: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/gmodels/index.html

data: http://archive.ics.uci.edu/

slide on automatic differentiation: in Python: https://github.com/HIPS
